<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>

static int spinlock(void)
{
	struct metal_spinlock lock = METAL_SPINLOCK_INIT;
	const int threads = 10;
	int value, error;

	error = metal_run(threads, spinlock_thread, &lock);
	if (!error) {
		value = total;
		value -= spinlock_test_count * threads;
		if (value) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "counter mismatch, delta = %d\n",
				  value);
			error = -EINVAL;
		}
	}

	return error;
}

int metal_run(int threads, metal_thread_t child, void *arg)
{
	pthread_t tids[threads];
	int error, ts_created;

	error = metal_run_noblock(threads, child, arg, tids, &ts_created);

	metal_finish_threads(ts_created, (void *)tids);

	return error;
}
...
int metal_run_noblock(int threads, metal_thread_t child,
		     void *arg, void *tids, int *threads_out)
{
	int error, i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}

	error = 0;
	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++) {
		error = -pthread_create(&tid_p[i], NULL, child, arg);
		if (error) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to create thread - %s\n",
				  strerror(error));
			break;
		}
	}

	*threads_out = i;
	return error;
}
...
void metal_finish_threads(int threads, void *tids)
{
	int i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return;
	}

	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++)
		(void)pthread_join(tid_p[i], NULL);
}
...
static void *spinlock_thread(void *arg)
{
	struct metal_spinlock *l = arg;
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < spinlock_test_count; i++) {
		metal_spinlock_acquire(l);
		total++;
		metal_spinlock_release(l);
	}

	return NULL;
}

explanation:
I inspected the provided code for uses of functions from <string.h> (e.g., memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, strspn, and other string-handling calls). The only direct reference to a standard string facility in the shown fragments is the call to strerror(error) inside the pthread_create error handling; that call is included above because it returns a char * and interacts with C string handling APIs and thus should be reviewed with regard to buffer/locale/implementation behavior. I also included the metal_log macro definition because it performs formatting/forwarding of format strings (it invokes metal_fmt(fmt) and the logger) and may hide further formatting/string handling in code not shown here; that macro expansion site (and any called helpers like metal_fmt or the log handler) should be inspected in the rest of the codebase for uses of <string.h> functions that could access out-of-bounds buffers.

All other fragments in the supplied code do not call or reference <string.h> functions and do not perform raw pointer-based string/buffer manipulation in the shown code: spinlock(), metal_run(), metal_finish_threads(), spinlock_thread(), the static variable definitions, the struct definition, METAL_SPINLOCK_INIT, and the pthread_join/pthread_create invocations (other than the strerror call already flagged) do not use the string-handling functions listed by Rule 21.17 and therefore do not need to be investigated for this specific rule based on the provided snippets.
